markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 3"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[One Hundred Victories](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2214)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Tattoo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=262" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Treasure Vault](/Sources.aspx?ID=191) pg. 121 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Price** 60 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** tattooed on the body

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

One hundred cuts, healed into diamond-shaped scars, represent the ability to withstand the attacks of your enemies. [Orc](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=19) warriors covet these scar patterns and cluster them around what they consider to be their strongest assets—a pattern around the heart signifies a warrior with great endurance, while one along the arms indicates great upper body strength. 

You gain a +1 item bonus to [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) checks. If you have [Ferocity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=16) (such as from the [Orc Ferocity](/Feats.aspx?ID=83) feat or a similar ability), the first time each day you use it, instead of remaining at 1 Hit Point, your Hit Points are set to an amount equal to your ancestry Hit Points, even if this amount is more than you had before using Ferocity.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: One Hundred Victories

Orc warriors covet these scar patterns and cluster them around what they consider to be their strongest assets—a pattern around the heart signifies a warrior with great endurance, while one along the arms indicates great upper body strength. You gain a +1 item bonus to Intimidation checks. If you have Ferocity (such as from the Orc Ferocity feat or a similar ability), the first time each day you use it, instead of remaining at 1 Hit Point, your Hit Points are set to an amount equal to your ancestry Hit Points, even if this amount is more than you had before using Ferocity.
